comments.html:
> Carrier’s Carrier architecture (is anyone using that?)

GEANT.org has one CsC VPN active: the MD-VPN (Multi-Domain). There might be a second one together with ESNET for "LHCONE".

I like that CsC idea especially when JunOS offers VPNs type "mpls-forwarding" for validation of labels against advertised routes via BGP-LU (sort of RPF checking). But I guess most networking people don't know how to perform Inter-AS MPLS and are better off with SD-WAN devices especially once managers / sales people become because it's "next gen"..

Per-prefix labeling for an Internet-in-VRF is impossible these days as the MPLS label space only allows for 1M prefixes and Internet for both IPv4 + IPv6 together exceeds that. Probably IPv4 next year exceeds that by itself if it hasn't already.
